entry.title: Does version management for purchase contract require flexible workflow setup?
entry.content:
Hello, I would like to set up version management for purchase contract which will be created via Manage Purchase Contract F1600A app (SAP S/4HANA 2023, On-premise). I am going through the menu below to set it up, but versioning is not triggered.

If I do the setup via the 'old' menu, i.e. Set Up Version Management for External Purchasing Documents, I get the versions generated (for changes via the app and also GUI), but Manage Purchase Contract app is still not showing the Version history tab.

I am wondering what is the right way to set up versioning for documents using the app. Do I have to set up a workflow?

I saw in SAP documentation that I have to 'Ensure the flexible workflow is activated before enabling versioning for purchase contracts.'

On the other hand, SAP note 3252885 says: 'Version management is not integrated completely with flexible workflow in MM Purchasing Business Objects such as PO, PR, Contracts, etc. It has not been considered in the integration as many MM Purchasing Fiori apps such as ‚ÄòManage Purchase Orders‚Äô does not support the classic version management..' 

So, I am a bit confused which one is the right way...

Regards,

Roumi

entry.title: "In every number, a narrative unfolds."
entry.content:
In today‚Äôs fast-evolving business landscape, the role of financial statements has transformed from merely being compliance documents to strategic tools that drive business decisions. For professionals, especially in high-growth sectors like technology, real-time and integrated reporting is crucial for maintaining a competitive edge.

 

Understanding how financial statements connect is fundamental to managing business performance. While many perceive the Income Statement, Balance Sheet, and Cash Flow Statement as separate reports, they are in fact deeply interconnected. Each offers a unique lens on business health ‚Äî profitability, financial position, and liquidity ‚Äî yet the true insight emerges only when one understands how they flow into one another.

The visual framework popularized by Brian Feroldi provides a clear and intuitive demonstration of how numbers travel across these statements and how every financial decision leaves its footprint throughout the reporting structure.

 

 

 

The Income Statement ‚Äì Measuring Profitability

The Income Statement (or Profit & Loss Statement) captures a company‚Äôs performance over a given period. It records revenues, costs, and expenses to show whether the company operated profitably.

In the example shown:

  • Revenue increases from $100,000 to $120,000, indicating business growth.
  • Cost of Goods Sold (COGS) rises from $50,000 to $55,000, slightly reducing gross profit.
  • Operating Expenses move from $25,000 to $30,000, showing higher overhead or investment in capability.
  • Depreciation of $10,000 remains a non-cash charge but still impacts reported profit.
  • Net Income improves from $15,000 to $22,500, feeding directly into both the Cash Flow Statement and the Shareholders‚Äô Equity section of the Balance Sheet.

The Income Statement provides the first key input into how the company‚Äôs performance translates into its financial position.

The Balance Sheet ‚Äì Capturing Financial Position

The Balance Sheet provides a snapshot at a point in time ‚Äî what the company owns (assets), owes (liabilities), and retains (equity).

Let‚Äôs look at how the data connects:

  • Cash drops from $70,000 to $7,500, reflecting total outflows from operations, investing, and financing activities.
  • Receivables decrease from $25,000 to $20,000, improving cash collection and liquidity.
  • Inventory increases from $10,000 to $15,000, consuming cash as the company builds stock.
  • Property, Plant & Equipment expands from $140,000 to $180,000, representing capital expenditure.
  • Shareholders‚Äô Equity grows from $105,000 to $127,500, driven by retained earnings from the Income Statement.

Every change on the Balance Sheet corresponds to a business event ‚Äî cash collected, inventory purchased, assets invested, or profits retained ‚Äî and each of these has a direct impact on the Cash Flow Statement.

The Cash Flow Statement ‚Äì Explaining Liquidity

The Cash Flow Statement bridges the gap between profitability (Income Statement) and position (Balance Sheet). It translates accrual accounting into actual cash movements, showing whether a company‚Äôs operations truly generate or consume cash.

Here‚Äôs how the example unfolds:

  • Net Income of $22,500 flows in from the Income Statement.
  • Depreciation of $5,000 is added back since it‚Äôs a non-cash charge.
  • Inventory increase of $5,000 consumes cash, while a $5,000 drop in Receivables releases cash.
  • Capital Expenditures of $50,000 appear under Investing Activities, reducing available cash.
  • Changes in Debt (-$35,000) reflect loan repayments under Financing Activities.

The resulting Change in Cash of ($62,500) reconciles perfectly with the drop in the cash balance on the Balance Sheet.

How the Three Statements Connect

Financial statements do not stand alone ‚Äî they are dynamically linked.
Here‚Äôs how key relationships flow:

Relationship

Flow Between Statements

Impact

Net Income ‚Üí Retained Earnings

Income Statement ‚Üí Balance Sheet

Increases equity

Depreciation ‚Üí Assets & Cash Flow

Income Statement ‚Üí Cash Flow ‚Üí Balance Sheet

Reduces profit, but no cash impact

CapEx ‚Üí PP&E and Cash

Cash Flow ‚Üí Balance Sheet

Reduces cash, increases long-term assets

Receivables / Payables Changes

Balance Sheet ‚Üî Cash Flow

Impact working capital and liquidity

Debt & Dividends ‚Üí Financing Section

Balance Sheet ‚Üî Cash Flow

Reflect funding and shareholder payouts

This seamless linkage ensures that every recorded transaction has a corresponding and traceable financial impact across all three reports ‚Äî maintaining integrity and completeness in reporting.

Modernizing Financial Linkages with SAP Group Reporting

In today‚Äôs digital finance landscape, these connections are no longer manually tracked ‚Äî they are automated and reconciled in real time through SAP S/4HANA Group Reporting powered with AI and Narrative Insights

This solution extends the power of the Universal Journal (ACDOCA) ‚Äî SAP‚Äôs single source of truth ‚Äî by unifying transactional, statutory, and management data across entities.

 

 

Key advantages include:

  • Real-Time Integration: Income Statement, Balance Sheet, and Cash Flow are automatically linked at both entity and group levels.
  • Automated Cash Flow Derivation: Systemically derives cash flow movements from accounting entries (e.g., changes in receivables, payables, assets).
  • Built-In Consolidation: Intercompany eliminations, ownership calculations, and currency translations occur within a unified environment.
  • Transparency and Auditability: Every reported number can be traced back to source entries, enhancing confidence during close and reporting cycles.
  • End-to-End Performance View: Finance leaders can assess profitability, liquidity, and leverage across subsidiaries in one integrated dashboard.

With SAP Group Reporting, the conceptual flow between the three financial statements becomes a real-time digital continuum, enabling CFOs to close faster, report more accurately, and plan more intelligently.

Financial statements are not isolated reports ‚Äî they form an interconnected system that narrates the complete story of business performance.
Understanding their linkage helps finance professionals interpret not just what happened, but why it happened and how it affects future cash and value.

 Understanding their connections help us see not just what has happened, but why, and what the future may hold. With intelligent tools and clear insight, professionals can turns complex numbers into a narrative that guides company towards smarter decisions and greater success.

Srinath Ganesan

entry.title: Entity PRODUCTPURCHASEORDERTEXT is not maintainable in Product API error
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am working with the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and trying to perform a POST operation using the Product (API_PRODUCT_2) API.
However, I‚Äôm receiving the following error response:

{
  "error": {
    "code": "CMD_PROD_RAP/011",
    "message": "Entity PRODUCTPURCHASEORDERTEXT is not maintainable",
    "target": "_ProductPurchaseOrderText(Product='102010000009',TextObjectType='BEST',Language='EN')",
    "details": [
      {
        "code": "CMD_PROD_RAP/011",
        "message": "Entity PRODUCTPROCUREMENT is not maintainable",
        "target": "_ProductProcurement"
      },
      {
        "code": "CMD_PROD_RAP/011",
        "message": "Entity PRODUCTPLANTPROCUREMENT is not maintainable",
        "target": "_ProductPlant(Product='102010000009',Plant='CN7A')/_ProductPlantProcurement"
      }
    ],
    "innererror": {
      "ErrorDetails": {
        "@SAP__common.Application": {
          "ComponentId": "LO-MD-MM",
          "ServiceRepository": "SRVD_A2X",
          "ServiceId": "API_PRODUCT_2",
          "ServiceVersion": "0001"
        },
        "@SAP__common.TransactionId": "86545C3DDA130010E0068E7D20C1703B",
        "@SAP__common.Timestamp": "20251009154237.258522",
        "@SAP__common.ErrorResolution": {
          "Analysis": "Use ADT feed reader 'SAP Gateway Error Log' or run transaction /IWFND/ERROR_LOG on SAP Gateway hub system and search for entries with the timestamp above for more details",
          "Note": "See SAP Note 1797736 for error analysis"
        }
      }
    }
  }
}

My Question:

  • Why are these entities (PRODUCTPURCHASEORDERTEXT, PRODUCTPROCUREMENT, PRODUCTPLANTPROCUREMENT) not maintainable through the post API?

  • Are there any restrictions in the Public Cloud Edition for maintaining these sub-entities via API?

  • Is there an alternative API or approach to update these product procurement or purchase order text details?

 

I‚Äôve already checked the payload structure and API reference documentation, and the JSON is valid. The base product entity is being read successfully ‚Äî the error occurs only during the POST operation.

Any insights or SAP Notes related to this behavior would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance,
Janarthanan R.

entry.title: Re: Can I Skip a SAP SuccessFactors Stay Current Assessme...
entry.content:
@Niladri_B_Nayak, that is correct. Completion of both 1H (May) and 2H (November) release deltas is not mandatory to maintain your certification. Under the updated Stay Certified program, the requirement has shifted from a 90-day deadline to a 12-month deadline.

To remain certified, you only need to complete one delta assessment every 12 months. Once you complete a delta, your certification validity automatically extends 12 months from the date of that completion.

It is strongly recommended that you stay up to date with each release and complete the bi-annual (1H and 2H) delta assessments as they become available. This ensures you remain current with the latest SuccessFactors product updates and innovations. However, from a certification maintenance perspective, only one delta every 12 months is required.

You can check your certification status within SAP Learning, which is the source of truth for all certification details, including your current status and upcoming deadlines. The platform will notify you when action is required, but if you‚Äôre ever unsure, please always verify directly here: My Learning Progress

For additional questions on staying certified, please refer here: Staying certified - FAQ

entry.title: gCTS in SAP S/4HANA 2025
entry.content:
Let‚Äôs start with two important changes that require your immediate attention:

  • ‚Ä¢A new Java version is required. So if you are upgrading your system to SAP S/4HANA 2025 for example from SAP S/4HANA 2023, you need to update your Java, as well. If you don‚Äôt do so, gCTS will not work any more. The required Java version is Open JDK version 17 or SAP Machine 21 (Long Term Support) or higher.
    For details, please read Prerequisites for Git-Enabled Change and Transport System.
  • Credentials (for example to connect to your Git-Provider) are now client-specific! No worries, credentials that you have created in previous releases still work. Only when you create new ones or touch exiting ones, these credentials will be turned to client-specific. This means that you have to create or change credentials i
  • n every client that you use. So if you use gCTS in several clients of one system, inform your users about this change. All users need to maintain their credentials themselves. Details are available on the SAP Help Portal at: Set User-Specific Authentication.

That‚Äôs it for the essential changes that you need to take into consideration.
There is one additional point that does not require any action but that you should know: An additional commit will be added to every repository that you connect to gCTS when you push your first objects (from ADT or as manual push in the gCTS app). This commit adds a properties file to the repository.

 

 

 

 

If you like to know more about the content of this file, please read on on the SAP Help Portal at The gCTS Properties File.
You can use this commit to delete the content of a repository from an ABAP system. When you pull this commit that initializes the gCTS properties file, the content of the repository is deleted from the ABAP system. If you pull the initial commit instead, it's possible that gCTS can't delete the entire content of the repository from the ABAP system.


Now, let‚Äôs look into new functionality of gCTS in SAP S/4HANA 2025.

You might already have seen in earlier releases that you can schedule some actions in the background - immediately or at a point in time that you specify. This has now been enhanced by the option to schedule Merge Branch and Deploy actions as background activities.

You can also find the respective options on the Jobs tab when you create a new job.

You can find the details on the SAP Help Portal at: Schedule Background Jobs for gCTS Activities.

Dependencies between repositories are now taken into consideration when you run pull options in a repository. This means that you get a pop-up showing required dependencies when you e.g. clone or update a repository or switch to another branch.

There can be for sure many more entries on this screen if you have more dependencies. It can also happen that you have to decide which version you want to pull, if you have contradicting dependencies in place. You can find the details explained on the SAP Help Portal at: Deploy Dependencies.

And one more point concerning parameters: You can now set a parameter to global directly instead of only being able to do so when you edit the parameter. Details are available on the SAP Help Portal at Set Additional Configuration Parameters for Repositories.

Last but not least one thing that not only concerns gCTS but also the ‚Äòrest‚Äô of your transports ‚Äì but only if you use gCTS:
In the request overview in the Transport Organizer (transaction SE09), change requests without a transport target as known from the classic Change and Transport System (CTS) were labelled as Local Change Requests. When using Git-Enabled CTS (gCTS), change requests that have a target repository as the transport target were also displayed under this category, because they don't have a classic transport target. However, these change requests aren't local change requests.
To avoid confusion in systems where gCTS is used, the Local Change Requests category was renamed to No Target System. This change reflects the growing use of gCTS in ABAP systems. For details, please check Request Overview on the SAP Help Portal.
That‚Äôs it for a rough overview ‚Äì you can find all the changes with links to the respective documentation topics listed in What's New Viewer - SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition | SAP Help Portal.


We hope that this news help you when you use gCTS. Feedback is more than welcome ‚Äì please feel free to comment on this blog post, ask questions, or write your feedback to a specific topic on SAP Help Portal.

Thanks for reading!

entry.title: Re: Why Preliminary billing document rejected by workflow...
entry.content:
Based on your post, the background is currently, when a finalized preliminary billing document is rejected via flexible workflow (WS02000042), only the approval status (VBRK-APM_APPROVAL_STATUS = 'C') is updated. The document status (VBRK-PBD_STATUS) remains 'B' (Finalized), which prevents further editing or resetting to "In Progress." Users must manually reject the document via Fiori App F2875 to fully deactivate it.

The Business impact due to which is this two-step rejection process introduces unnecessary manual effort, increases the risk of oversight, and creates confusion for users expecting the document to be fully rejected after workflow rejection. So the proposal is to implement an enhancement or BAdI extension that automatically updates the document status (VBRK-PBD_STATUS) to 'D' (Rejected) when the workflow outcome is rejection.

The technical consideration is to explore the method AFTER_WORKFLOW_STEP_EXECUTION to intercept the rejection outcome. Add logic to update VBRK-PBD_STATUS to 'D' for the corresponding. Trigger a post-processing routine upon workflow rejection. Use function module SD_PBD_STATUS_UPDATE or similar to change the document status. billing document. Add a prompt or automation in F2874 to offer full rejection when workflow status is "Rejected."

entry.title: I‚Äôm Not an ABAPer, But I Shipped an SAP OData Service with AI
entry.content:
ü§ñ I‚Äôm Not an ABAPer, But I Shipped an SAP OData Service with AI

Disclaimer & Anonymization
Examples are anonymized and simplified. Replace placeholders like <EQUIP_NO>, <EQUIP_NO_PADDED> (18-char with leading zeros), <FUNC_LOC>, <SHORT_TEXT>, <LONG_TEXT>. You‚Äôll still need a bit of local effort to wire transports, authorizations, CSRF handling, and adjust BAPI structures in your own system.
 

When I first had to expose SAP Plant Maintenance notifications as an API, I wasn‚Äôt an ABAP developer. I live in the world of APIs, Node.js, and microservices ‚Äî not in SE80 or BAPIs. Still, with a little help from AI, I built a working SAP OData service that creates and retrieves PM notifications using the classic BAPI_ALM_NOTIF_CREATE.

This post is my path from ‚Äúwhat‚Äôs a BAPI?‚Äù to a fully functioning OData endpoint that anyone can call from Postman or a modern front-end app.

 

üß© The Challenge

We needed an API to create maintenance notifications (equipment breakdowns, inspection reports, etc.) from an external system into SAP.

SAP does ship a standard service (/sap/opu/odata/sap/API_MAINTNOTIFICATION), but it wasn‚Äôt enough. We needed custom validations, long text handling, and our own response messages. So I decided to build a custom OData service:

/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZSERVICE_PM_NOTIFICATION_SRV

The only problem? I‚Äôm not an ABAPer.

 

üß† Step 1: Let AI Draft the ABAP Skeleton

I asked ChatGPT (my ABAP copilot):

‚ÄúGenerate an OData service to create a Maintenance Notification with Equipment, FunctLoc, ShortText, and LongText.‚Äù

It gave me the SEGW model and even named the right BAPI (BAPI_ALM_NOTIF_CREATE). In SEGW, I created the project and an entity Notification like this:

Field Type Description

MaintenanceNotificationEdm.String(12) KeyNotification No
EquipmentEdm.String(18)Equipment No
FunctLocEdm.String(30)Functional Location
ShortTextEdm.String(40)Problem Description
LongTextEdm.String(1024)Additional Notes
MessageEdm.String(255)Response Message

Then I generated runtime artifacts ‚Üí MPC, DPC, and DPC_EXT classes. So far, no manual code.

 

‚öôÔ∏è Step 2: Let AI Build the CREATE_ENTITY Logic

The AI produced a clean version I pasted into
ZCL_ZPM_NOTIF_DPC_EXT ‚Üí NOTIFICATIONSET_CREATE_ENTITY.

METHOD notificationset_create_entity.
  DATA: ls_in  TYPE zcl_zpm_notif_mpc=>ts_notif,
        ls_out TYPE zcl_zpm_notif_mpc=>ts_notif,
        ls_hdr TYPE bapi2080_nothdri,
        lt_return TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF bapiret2,
        ls_return TYPE bapiret2,
        lv_notif TYPE qmnum,
        lv_notif_c TYPE char12.

  " Read payload from POST JSON
  io_data_provider->read_entry_data( IMPORTING es_data = ls_in ).

  IF ls_in-shorttext IS INITIAL.
    RAISE EXCEPTION TYPE /iwbep/cx_mgw_busi_exception
      EXPORTING message = 'ShortText is required'.
  ENDIF.

  " Optional but recommended: pad equipment to 18 (ALPHA)
  IF ls_in-equipment IS NOT INITIAL.
    DATA(lv_equ) = ls_in-equipment.
    CALL FUNCTION 'CONVERSION_EXIT_ALPHA_INPUT'
      EXPORTING input  = lv_equ
      IMPORTING output = lv_equ.
    ls_hdr-equipment = lv_equ.
  ENDIF.

  " Map input to BAPI header
  ls_hdr-descript  = ls_in-shorttext.
  ls_hdr-funct_loc = ls_in-functloc.
  IF ls_hdr-equipment IS INITIAL.
    ls_hdr-equipment = ls_in-equipment.
  ENDIF.

  " Call BAPI to create the notification
  CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_ALM_NOTIF_CREATE'
    EXPORTING
      notif_type  = 'M1'
      notifheader = ls_hdr
    IMPORTING
      number      = lv_notif
    TABLES
      return      = lt_return.

  " Save and commit the notification
  CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_ALM_NOTIF_SAVE'
    EXPORTING number = lv_notif
    TABLES    return = lt_return.

  CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_TRANSACTION_COMMIT'
    EXPORTING wait = abap_true.

  " Format notification number
  lv_notif_c = |{ lv_notif ALPHA = OUT }|.

  " Prepare OData response
  ls_out-maintenancenotification = lv_notif_c.
  ls_out-equipment               = ls_in-equipment.
  ls_out-functloc                = ls_in-functloc.
  ls_out-shorttext               = ls_in-shorttext.
  ls_out-longtext                = ls_in-longtext.
  ls_out-message                 = |Created notification { lv_notif_c }|.

  er_entity = ls_out.
ENDMETHOD.

Even though AI wrote the ABAP, I learned:

  • io_data_provider maps JSON ‚Üí ABAP structure.
  • er_entity sends back the OData response.
  • BAPI_ALM_NOTIF_CREATE creates the record; BAPI_ALM_NOTIF_SAVE + COMMIT persists it.
  • Tip: Equipment often requires leading zeros (ALPHA) or you‚Äôll hit ‚ÄúEquipment not found‚Äù.
 

üîç Step 3: Testing the OData Endpoint

In /IWFND/GW_CLIENT, I ran:

POST /sap/opu/odata/sap/ZSERVICE_PM_NOTIFICATION_SRV/NotificationSet
Payload
{
  "Equipment": "<EQUIP_NO>",
  "FunctLoc": "<FUNC_LOC>",
  "ShortText": "<SHORT_TEXT>",
  "LongText": "<LONG_TEXT>"
}
Response
{
  "d": {
    "MaintenanceNotification": "100012345678",
    "Equipment": "<EQUIP_NO>",
    "FunctLoc": "<FUNC_LOC>",
    "ShortText": "<SHORT_TEXT>",
    "Message": "Created notification 100012345678"
  }
}

That was the moment ‚Äî the notification number finally showed up üéâ.

 

üß© Step 4: Add a ‚ÄúView All Notifications‚Äù Endpoint

To list notifications, AI suggested BAPI_ALM_NOTIF_GETLIST. Minimal example:

METHOD notificationset_get_entityset.
  DATA: lt_notif TYPE TABLE OF bapi2080_notif_list,
        ls_notif TYPE bapi2080_notif_list.

  CALL FUNCTION 'BAPI_ALM_NOTIF_GETLIST'
    EXPORTING  notif_type = 'M1'
    TABLES     notiflist  = lt_notif.

  LOOP AT lt_notif INTO ls_notif.
    APPEND VALUE zcl_zpm_notif_mpc=>ts_notif(
      maintenancenotification = ls_notif-notif_no
      shorttext               = ls_notif-descript
      functloc                = ls_notif-funct_loc
      equipment               = ls_notif-equipment
    ) TO et_entityset.
  ENDLOOP.
ENDMETHOD.

Now I can hit:

GET /sap/opu/odata/sap/ZSERVICE_PM_NOTIFICATION_SRV/NotificationSet

‚Ä¶and get a clean JSON list of maintenance notifications.

 

ü™≤ Step 5: Debugging (with Help from AI)

When the notification number didn‚Äôt return, AI helped me debug like this:

  • Set External Breakpoints in ZCL_ZPM_NOTIF_DPC_EXT.
  • Use /IWFND/GW_CLIENT ‚Üí POST again to hit the breakpoint.
  • Watch: ls_hdr-descript, ls_hdr-equipment, lv_notif, ls_out-maintenancenotification.
  • If it doesn‚Äôt stop, check:
    • /IWBEP/ERROR_LOG (Gateway errors)
    • /IWFND/TRACES (payload/trace)
    • ST22 (ABAP dumps)

Common fixes

  • Equipment padding: CONVERSION_EXIT_ALPHA_INPUT before calling the BAPI.
  • Wrong notif type: switch between M1/M2 as per your config.
  • CSRF: fetch token first; then POST with token + JSON.
  • Authorizations: ensure users can create that notification type/plant.
 

üß† Lessons Learned (as a Non-ABAP Developer)

Lesson Explanation

BAPI ‚âà SAP‚Äôs internal APIThink of BAPI_ALM_NOTIF_CREATE as a function that writes a record.
ALPHA = OUTFormats numbers with leading zeros for display (e.g., 1234 ‚Üí 000000001234).
DPC_EXTWhere you write logic; like a controller in Node.js.
er_entity = ls_outYour OData response back to the caller.
/IWFND/GW_CLIENTSAP‚Äôs built-in Postman!
 

üß© Step 6 (Optional): Long Text

If your payload has long descriptions, add a helper:

IF ls_in-longtext IS NOT INITIAL.
  me->add_qmel_longtext(
    iv_notifno = lv_notif_c,
    iv_longtxt = CONV string( ls_in-longtext )
  ).
ENDIF.

This will save long text into SAP‚Äôs long-text tab automatically (implement your helper with SAVE_TEXT).

 

üÜò Troubleshooting prompt (copy & paste into AI)

Use this when something fails. Replace placeholders with your values.

Prompt:
You are an SAP Gateway & PM ABAP/OData debugger. I have an OData service that creates PM Notifications. Analyze and give exact fix steps with code diffs.

Context
- System/SID/Client: <SID>/<CLIENT>
- Endpoint: <HOST>/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZSERVICE_PM_NOTIFICATION_SRV/NotificationSet (or V4 path)
- Action: POST create notification
- Error (verbatim): "<ERROR_TEXT>"
- /IWBEP/ERROR_LOG ID: <LOG_ID> (stack excerpt below)
- Payload JSON: { "Equipment": "<EQUIP_NO>", "FunctLoc": "<FUNC_LOC>", "ShortText": "<SHORT_TEXT>", "LongText": "<LONG_TEXT>" }
- Code snippet(s): DPC_EXT create_entity + NOTIFICATIONSET_CREATE_ENTITY
- BAPI flow: BAPI_ALM_NOTIF_CREATE ‚Üí BAPI_ALM_NOTIF_SAVE ‚Üí BAPI_TRANSACTION_COMMIT

Please verify
1) Equipment padding (ALPHA to 18 chars) and existence in EQUI/EQKT; try <EQUIP_NO_PADDED>.
2) Correct notif_type (M1/M2) and header mapping (funct_loc, equipment, short_text).
3) CSRF token and Content-Type; provide exact curl/Postman sequence if wrong.
4) Authorization/object checks for plant and notification type.
5) Number ranges if equipment creation fails (SNRO: EQUIP_NR, OIEN assignment).
6) Gateway exception mapping to /iwbep/cx_mgw_busi_exception messages.
7) If RAP/CDS path is used, handler create logic and service binding.

Artifacts
- ERROR_LOG excerpt: <PASTE_LOG>
- Code snippet: <PASTE_DPC_EXT_METHOD>

Deliver a concise fix with the exact ABAP line(s)/payload to change.
 

üéØ The Final Result

  • A custom OData service ZSERVICE_PM_NOTIFICATION_SRV
  • A POST endpoint to create notifications
  • A GET endpoint to view them
  • AI-generated ABAP that actually worked
  • And a newfound respect for the SAP Gateway debugger üòÖ
 

üîÆ Takeaway

You don‚Äôt have to be an ABAP veteran to build SAP OData services. With AI assistance, patience, and a few SAP debugging tools, even integration engineers can craft end-to-end APIs that interact directly with the core system.

Author: Sayantan Tarafdar
Title: How I Used AI to Build an SAP PM Notification OData API (as a Non-ABAP Developer)
Tags: #SAPBTP #OData #BAPI_ALM_NOTIF_CREATE #PlantMaintenance #Integration #ABAPForNonABAPers

entry.title: Re: Guidelines for content created with generative AI
entry.content: I will add a simple rule of thumb: If you don‚Äôt have an answer to a particular question, you can ask GenAI to give you a hint or a direction to explore. However, all the GenAI generated hints need to be verified in the system for its accuracy before posting as an answer. Otherwise, don‚Äôt use the GenAI generated content especially when you are not a subject-matter-expert to judge it.

entry.title: Re: Solution manager Charm 7.2 on premise integration wit...
entry.content:
Hi there,

You can indeed go for an add-on / custom connector from 3rd party vendors as suggested.

The alternative, since there is no standard API for change management is by writing custom code. In short, you can write ABAP classes and expose them as a web service in order to handle interfacing that way. Ideally, you get a developer who has some CRM knowledge - since SAP Solution Manager's CHARM is build on top of a SAP CRM component. With the right developer, you can code what you want to have there in terms of being able to interface with 3rd party products.

Best regards

Tom

entry.title: Re: Is it possible to have value help for custom field ba...
entry.content:
Hello @P00019191 

In addition to your question

How the authorisation check is maintained for a CDS-based code list (Public Cloud)

Create or choose a value-help CDS that includes the auth field, such as Company Code / BUKRS. Bind it to your custom field as ‚ÄúCode list based on CDS view‚Äù and ensure it respects authorisation access protection through its primary source, SAP Support Portal-3612451 - Custom Fields - Frequently Asked Questions - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

In Maintain Business Roles (Fiori app), Configure the role‚Äôs Read/Value Help access to Restricted and specify the permitted Company Codes. During runtime, these role restrictions limit the CDS value help, ensuring users only see values for the company codes they are authorised for. SAP Help Portal-Identity and Access Management-Maintain Business Roles

KBAs (brief summaries):

KBA 3612451 ‚Äì Custom Fields ‚Äì FAQ: Confirms the setup for Code list based on CDS view, including how to select the correct value-help view; static code lists do not support authorisation-based filtering.

KBA 2733842 ‚Äì Business Role restrictions UI: Demonstrates how to switch Write/Read/Value Help to Restricted and retain values‚Äîthis is where the filter for the value help is applied. SAP Support Portal-2733842 - Business Role has No Access for Restriction Areas that are Not Maintained - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

With best regards

Chuma

entry.title: Understanding SAP SuccessFactors Transport Center
entry.content:
In the dynamic world of HR digital transformation, change is constant ‚Äî whether it‚Äôs implementing new features, updating business rules, or refining workflows. As organizations scale their SAP SuccessFactors environments across multiple modules and geographies, transporting configurations between environments becomes both a necessity and a challenge.

This is where SAP SuccessFactors Transport Center plays a pivotal role.

What is SAP SuccessFactors Transport Center?

SAP SuccessFactors Transport Center is a pivotal tool designed to streamline the management and deployment of configurations across various environments within the SAP SuccessFactors suite. It facilitates the efficient transfer of data and settings, ensuring consistency and accuracy in system configurations. By leveraging this tool, organisations can enhance their operational efficiency, reduce the risk of errors, and maintain a seamless workflow across different stages of development and production.

Key Features:

‚Ä¢ Centralized Management: Manage and monitor all transport activities from one place. Assign permissions to control who can create, approve, and deploy transports.
‚Ä¢ Role-Based Access: Ensure that only authorized users can perform specific actions. Supports segregation of duties for compliance.
‚Ä¢ Bundle Configurations: Group multiple related artifacts into a single transport bundle for consistency and ease of deployment.
‚Ä¢ Audit Trail & Version Control: Track what was moved, when, by whom, and from which system to which.
‚Ä¢ Pre-Check & Validation: Validates objects before deployment to prevent dependency errors or missing references.

How Transport Center Works:

Transport Center follows a structured transport lifecycle:

1. Create Transport Bundle
2. Review & Approve
3. Deploy
4. Monitor

What Can You Transport?

Transport Center supports configurations for:

- Employee Central: Business rules, Workflows, Picklists, Foundation objects
- Performance and Goals: Templates, Route maps
- Recruiting: Configuration objects (limited)
- Compensation: Plan templates (limited support)
- Generic Objects

Note: Some modules may still require manual transport or legacy methods.

Security and Governance:

Transport Center ensures compliance with change management standards through:
- Change history logs
- User-based approval flows
- Role-Based Permissions (RBP)
- Alerts and notifications

Benefits of Using Transport Center:

‚Ä¢ Consistency: Reduces human errors caused by manual methods
‚Ä¢ Compliance: Aligns with audit requirements
‚Ä¢ Speed: Faster deployments
‚Ä¢ Collaboration: Streamlines team workflows
‚Ä¢ Error Prevention: Reduces risks with validations

Best Practices for Using Transport Center:

1. Use meaningful naming conventions
2. Test in lower environments first
3. Use role-based permissions
4. Schedule deployments during off-hours
5. Monitor logs post-deployment

What‚Äôs Next?

SAP plans to expand the Transport Center with:
- Wider module support
- Enhanced reporting
- Integration with SAP Cloud ALM and Solution Manager

Final Thoughts

As organizations evolve their SAP SuccessFactors landscapes, Transport Center becomes a must-have tool for reliable configuration movement. It's not just about moving data ‚Äî it‚Äôs about governing change and enabling faster innovation cycles.

entry.title: ü§¨ SAP Public Cloud: It's not a Bug, it's a feature not yet localized
entry.content:
Recently, SAP Support has started using a new phrase... "It's not a Bug, it's a feature not yet localized for xxx Country"

2 different instances that I faced recently:

  • RAP BO: I_BILLINGDOCUMENTTP Action CreateFromExternalData
    • Issue: Dump happens during Save phase
    • Reason: For Brazil, there are some mandatory field checks coded within the Billing Document Save that throws Messages, which RAP engine doesn't like, and thus results in a BEHAVIOR_ILLEGAL_STATEMENT dump.
    • Response: ......The localization of the 1Z6 scope item was carried out using the API with SOAP, and this process does not involve the I_BillingDocumentTP Business Object.....
  • RAP BO: I_PURCHASEORDERTP_2 Action Create
    • Issue: Delivery Address passed in the RAP BO by calling program, isn't considered for Tax calculation
    • Reason: The bug is identified in Class CL_TXS_FM_ADDRESS, method GET_ADDRESS_COMPLETE. The class is passing both address number & address handle to the function module ADDR_GET_COMPLETE, and this results in a Parameter_error Exception. The exception is happening because both parameters contain value. If address handle is populated, then only address handle must be passed to the function. If address handle is not populated, only then pass the address number. This requires a simple fix. A simple IF condition before the Function module call will avoid the Parameter_Error exception.
    • Response: ....However, since you are using a Z class for the creation of the Purchase Order, we cannot guarantee that the process will work properly, as the document creation flow is different. This also happens when using some Fiori Apps, such as Manage Purchase Order, for example....... I would like to emphasize that this is not a SAP bug, but rather a scenario that is not localized for Brazil, since in these contexts we are directly consuming an MM Core logic. If you use the localized VH Create Purchase Order - Advanced (ME21N), you won't face any issues.......

It is incredibly painful to get together enough people to vote on a request for a new API on Influence portal, since everyone who are working with Public Cloud, may not face the same requirement at the same exact time. And, until they face the issue, they may not bother to come to Influence portal and search for the request and vote on it. Even if we do all that, and gather enough votes and gather SAP's attention to put in a development request for the API, what I hear now is released APIs are still not to be trusted, because they may not be localized for a specific country or a specific scenario and it takes another Influence ticket in Localization Influence Portal, and the same chain of processes, for it to become useful.

What does released API even mean? Where on API hub is the documentation/list of localized APIs?

entry.title: Re: API Consumption from S4 Hana Cloud Public Edition to...
entry.content:
Hello @LeonardoGarcia2 ,

The error is usually one of these:

1. Missing API version in the Service Root
In S/4HANA Public Cloud, the A2X OData V2 services are versioned. Include the version suffix in PaPM:

Product: /sap/opu/odata/sap/API_PRODUCT_SRV;v=0002/ (entity set A_Product)

Business Partner: /sap/opu/odata/sap/API_BUSINESS_PARTNER;v=0002/ (entity set A_BusinessPartner)
SAP Help documents the v=000x convention for OData V2 services. SAP Help Portal-APIs on SAP Business Accelerator Hub

2.Destination authentication
When transitioning from BTP/PaPM to S/4HANA Cloud, use OAuth2SAMLBearerAssertion instead of Basic authentication, referencing your S/4 Communication Arrangement details. SAP‚Äôs documentation recommends OAuth2SAML as the preferred configuration for S/4HANA Cloud destinations. SAP Help Portal-SAP S/4HANA Cloud

How could you fix it?

In BTP ‚Üí Destinations ‚Üí Check Connection, call the service root with $metadata ( /sap/opu/odata/sap/API_PRODUCT_SRV;v=0002/$metadata).

404 ‚Üí wrong path (usually missing; v=0002).

401/403 ‚Üí auth/role/scopes (switch to OAuth2SAML or fix the comm. arrangement/roles).

200 + EDMX ‚Üí destination is good; re-run in PaPM. (PaPM connection doc is here.) SAP Help Portal-Application Help for Universal Model-Manage Connections

Regarding ‚Äúget all data at once‚Äù:
set a higher Maximum page size (for example, 1000). S/4 will continue paginating large results using @odata.nextLink; PaPM automatically follows this link, so manual looping isn‚Äôt necessary. The general paging behaviour aligns with standard OData V2; details for Product/Business Partner API pages are provided here. SAP Help Portal-APIs for Master Data Maintenance-Business Partner (A2X) ‚Äì OData API

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

 

GenAI support generated content (SAP Useful references)

  • OData service versioning (v=000x) ‚Äî APIs on SAP Business Accelerator Hub / OData V2 (explicitly shows the version suffix). SAP Help Portal
  • Business Partner (A2X) API page (entity sets, usage). SAP Help Portal
  • PaPM Cloud ‚Äì Manage Connections (how PaPM consumes OData services). SAP Help Portal
  • Destinations to S/4HANA Cloud use OAuth2SAML (Integration Suite & BTP docs). SAP Help Portal

entry.title: Re: HSN/SAC CODE FIELD MISSING IN CREATE SUPPLIER INVOICE...
entry.content:
Hello @RAHULSOMANI 

1) Maintain HSN/SAC at G/L account?

In Public Cloud, you do NOT maintain HSN/SAC on the G/L account. The HSN/SAC is used for GST determination on a material (HSN) or service master (SAC); you also maintain the tax-code mapping against HSN/SAC in configuration. SAP Help Portal-Defining Control Codes for Harmonized System Nomenclature (HSN)

What you should do

Maintain the code within Material/Service Master (India localisation fields).  SAP KBA 2430349 - GST India: Maintenance of HSN/SAC Codes KBA 2430349 ‚Äì ‚ÄúGST India: Maintenance of HSN/SAC Codes‚Äù ‚Äî FAQ on the HSN/SAC value help and master-data prerequisites (useful if your F4 list is empty or validation errors appear

In the configuration, ensure that the Tax Type/Tax Code is linked to HSN/SAC so that tax can be calculated accordingly and posted. SAP Help Portal-Maintaining Tax Type and Tax Code against HSN_SAC/Material

2) Is the HSN/SAC editable on a non-PO supplier invoice line?In Create/Manage Supplier Invoices for an IN-company code, you can enter or override the HSN/SAC field at the item level if it's not derived from a master. Refer to India-specific steps in the Supplier Invoice app help. SAP Help Portal-Create Supplier Invoice

SAP Help: Useful documentation

Maintain a combination of Tax Type and Tax Code against HSN/SAC/Material ‚Äî explains the HSN/SAC-to-tax mapping used during posting. SAP Help Portal-Maintaining Tax Type and Tax Code against HSN_SAC/Material

Material/Service Master ‚Äì link to HSN/SAC ‚Äî shows where to keep HSN/SAC in masters for India localization. SAP Help Portal/Defining Control Codes for Harmonized System Nomenclature (HSN)

Create Supplier Invoice (India) ‚Äî confirms India fields on the invoice (line-level entry/override). SAP Help Portal-Create Supplier Invoice

entry.title: MRP Transfer Requirement Not Defaulting Source Storage Location
entry.content:
Description:

We are trying to enable automatic stock transfers between two storage locations within the same plant via MRP in SAP ECC.

  • Scenario:
    We have two storage locations: Sloc A (source) and Sloc B (destination) within the same plant.
    Sloc B is maintained in the material master (MRP 4 view) with the "Storage Location MRP Indicator = 2 (Plan separately)".

  • Issue:
    When there is demand in Sloc B, MRP correctly generates a transfer requirement with movement type 311. However, the source storage location (Sloc A) is not populated in the transfer requirement. This requires manual intervention, which we want to avoid.

  • Expected Behaviour:
    We expect MRP to automatically populate Sloc A as the source storage location in the transfer requirement whenever there is demand in Sloc B.

  • Request:
    Please advise on the configuration or master data setup required to ensure that the source storage location (Sloc A) is automatically filled in the transfer requirement created by MRP.

entry.title: Re: Can I Skip a SAP SuccessFactors Stay Current Assessme...
entry.content:
Hello
My name is Raquel Souza
I'm from Brazil üáßüá∑  and I'll try to help you with your question.

Official Information Found

  1. SAP ‚ÄúStay Certified / Stay Current‚Äù Policy

    • As of April 2024, all SAP certifications must be renewed annually through mandatory ‚Äústay certified‚Äù or ‚Äústay current‚Äù assessments to remain valid.
      (learning.sap.com ‚Äì Certification Transformation)

    • According to the How to Stay Certified SAP page, you must complete the assessment before your ‚Äústay certified due‚Äù date to extend your certification for another 12 months.

    • If you do not complete the assessment by the due date, your certification will be marked as expired.
      (learning.sap.com ‚Äì How to Stay Certified)

    • The official Certification Retirements FAQ states:

      ‚ÄúIf you do not complete the stay certified assessment before the expiry date, you will no longer be certified. To regain certification, you must complete a full SAP Certification exam.‚Äù
      (learning.sap.com ‚Äì Certification Retirements)

    ‚úÖ In short: skipping a ‚Äústay current‚Äù assessment before its due date causes the certification to expire.

    Certification Retirement Rules

    • When SAP officially retires a certification, anyone holding an active certification at that time may automatically receive an additional 12 months of validity, without taking a new assessment.

    • However, this applies only when the certification is retired by SAP ‚Äî it does not mean you can skip regular assessments at will.
      (learning.sap.com ‚Äì Certification Retirements)

      Insights from SAP Community

      • In a discussion on SAP Community, users asked the same question about skipping one ‚Äústay current‚Äù assessment for SAP SuccessFactors (for example, skipping the 2H/2025 assessment and taking the next one before August 2026).
        The consensus: you cannot skip one without risking expiration. You must complete all required assessments in sequence to maintain your certification status.
        (SAP Community Discussion)

      • Additionally, SuccessFactors certifications use semiannual delta assessments (2H and 1H updates), meaning assessments are typically required every six months to remain current.
        (ERP Wizard article)

        ‚öñÔ∏è Conclusion (with caution)

        Based on SAP‚Äôs official documentation and user experience:

        • You must complete each stay certified / stay current assessment before its due date to keep your certification valid.

        • If you skip one, your certification will be considered expired, and you will need to retake the full certification exam to regain it.

        • There is no official provision allowing you to skip one assessment (e.g., 2H/2025) and then take only the next (1H/2026) before expiry.

        • The only case in which you might automatically get an extension is if your certification is officially retired by SAP while it‚Äôs still valid.

          Recommendation

          If your certification (SAP SuccessFactors 8X, valid until August 2026) is under this rule:

          1. Check your SAP Learning Hub / My Learning profile for the ‚Äústay certified due date.‚Äù

          2. Contact SAP Certification Support directly to confirm if skipping one cycle is possible for your specific certification type.

          3. Request a written confirmation (email or support case response) to keep a formal record.
            I hope this helps. üòâ

entry.title: Re: Restrict users from editing a parked invoice
entry.content:
Hello @ornecogli,

The recommended approach is to control app access (read versus write) through business roles and/or utilise Flexible Workflow for posting approvals.

SAP KBA 2598733 explains setting restrictions in roles, covering Read/Write/Value Help and restriction types. It is the main reference for role restrictions, noting no 'Invoice Status‚Äù restriction for supplier invoices. SAP Support Portal-KBA-2598733 - Maintain Restrictions in Business Role

SAP Help ‚Äì Supplier Invoices (Fiori app). Describes that parked invoices are saved without posting and remain editable‚Äîhence why you must control write-capable apps or use workflow, rather than a status-only restriction.

SAP Help: Flexible Workflow for Supplier Invoices outlines the process for requiring approval prior to posting (including parked-as-complete status), which is SAP‚Äôs recommended control method when allowing users to park or view invoices without granting posting permissions.https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0e602d466b99490187fcbb30d1dc897c/ff92035b3da94a14a3d2d0faffad564c.html

KBA 2598733 Maintain Restrictions in Business Role explains which elements can be restricted within roles, such as Read/Write/Value Help and restriction fields. There is no default restriction for "Invoice Status is equal Parked"; instead, access should be managed through app or catalogue assignment and write permissions. SAP KBA-2598733 - Maintain Restrictions in Business Role

If your client refuses to use workflow, an alternative is role design: assign ‚Äúpark-only‚Äù users the park/display apps, set Write = No Access on Manage Supplier Invoices to prevent editing or posting, and keep Read access as necessary. This approach is detailed in the role restrictions documentation above. SAP Learning-Maintaining Business Role Restrictions

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Printing of HU_shipping label
entry.content:
Hello @ST24 

Thank you for follow-up

In S/4HANA Public Cloud, there is no public print API to call HU-label printing. Timing is controlled by Output Management (OPD). To print after packing, not at HU creation, adjust your OPD rules for HU labels and, if needed, resend via Manage Output Items.

SAP Help: Useful official documentation.

Output Mgmt for Handling Unit Management (controls HU label timing). SAP Help Portal-Output Management for Handling Unit Management

Output Parameter Determination app (change conditions/timing). SAP Help Portal-Manage Your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition-Output Parameter Determination

Manage Output Items app (reprocess/resend output). SAP Help Portal-Manage Output Items

KBA 3629010 ‚Äì How to print HU labels from Warehouse Monitor (manual fallback path). SAP Support Portal-3629010 - Printing Handling Unit labels for Posting Change Documents in Warehouse Monitor App

KBA 3618070 ‚Äì Limitation on mass HU printing in Warehouse Monitor (expectations). SAP Support Portal-3618070 - Unable to print handling units in mass in App Warehouse Monitor

External OMS through Print Queues (official event-driven release option).SAP Help Portal-Integrating SAP S/4HANA and External Output Systems

With best regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: BTP Cloud Foundry trial - InsufficientResources - Ins...
entry.content:
Hey there, after trying everything, I finally tried this in my CAP Project and it worked for me, but it failed srv module once and worked at retry attempt 2.
Basically, I made the gen and mta files and redeployed. Below are the exact steps.
Hope this helps you guys: 
Before doing the following please note to copy UI Module if you don't know how to create it.
Then delete the mta.yaml and gen folder.
Then go to CLI:

  • cd <project namespace>
  • cds add hana
  • npm install
  • cds build --production (makes the gen folder)
  • cds add mta (makes mta.yaml)
  • cds add xsuaa (This adds the xsuaa to the mta.yaml), please check for the UI (app) module as well for fiori in mta.yaml.
  • npm install

Now, right click mta.yaml (build mta)

Then right-click mta_archives and click deploy  MTA ARCHIVE or type in CLI :

  • cd mta_archives
  • cf deploy <exact filename in mta_archives>
    Hope this helps.

entry.title: Re: Can we suspend interfaces by EventMesh?
entry.content:
Hello  

Thank you for your question

Have look at the blog: How to use SAP S/4HANA Event Enablement with SAP Cloud Platform (EN)

Yes, you can suspend interface event delivery safely without losing your data by temporarily pausing your subscription or consumer flow in the BTP integration Suite/Event Mesh instead of disabling event generation in the cloud.

Once you resume your subscription, Event Mesh will deliver all pending events to your consumers in FIFO order.

You cannot pause event creation from the cloud, but you can suspend delivery and processing by controlling the Event Mesh and Integration Suite.

Consult the following link for more details.

Create a Queue in the Event Mesh Instance

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_BUSINESSOBJECTS_BUSINESS_INTELLIGENCE_PLATFORM/a35562f321f74109b29008d25eb578de/ec9d46146fdb101497906a7cb0e91070.html?locale=en-US

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: How to apply filter for [specific criteria] in SAP (w...
entry.content:
Hello @nithin_pranesh 

The Manage Sales Inquiries app lacks Product in the filter bar, and in Public Cloud, you can only enable standard fields if SAP designates them as selection fields.

Supported solution

Build your own dataset (item-level) Create a Custom CDS View. Custom CDS Views design a CDS centred on the Inquiry Item to guarantee the Product is available. SAP Help-Custom CDS Views

Expose Product on the filter bar. Custom Analytical Queries create a query on top of your CDS; selection fields (incl. Product) appear in the query‚Äôs filter bar. SAP Help Portal-Custom Analytical Queries Define Custom Filters (Analytical Query)  how filters behave and are configured. SAP Help Portal-Define Custom Filters

If you truly need a brand-new attribute

Custom Fields & Logic ,create a custom field and enable it for Search/Filter where the app supports it. SAP Help Portal-    Extend and Integrate Your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

Summary:

You can not add a non-exposed standard field like Product to the delivered app‚Äôs filter bar. The supported path is, Custom CDS (item-level) ‚Üí Custom Analytical Query, which gives you a report where Product is filterable. Use Custom Fields  only when the field does not exist at all.

With best regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Currency Valuation Discrepancy on cleared Items
entry.content:
Hello @nbek 

Thank you for your question

Have a look at Advanced Foreign Currency Valuation

It is important to note that cleared item are still included in the valuation base for the valuation key date and this is the reason you experience that discrepancy. This happens even though the clearing posting have already neutralised exchange rate effects in accounting.

The FCV uses both the Open Item Management to valuate open FX items and Balance Valuation to valuate G/L balances.

If your cleared items remain in the valuation, they may count the exchange difference double. Meaning it will lead to mismatch in balances between trial and balance line item views.

Best regards

Chris
